newsitem.title: USA: US spot jet eases with NYMEX in sleepy trade.
newsitem.headline: US spot jet eases with NYMEX in sleepy trade.

text.p: U.S. spot jet fuel prices edged lower on Tuesday with weaker May NYMEX futures more than offsetting slightly firmer differentials, players said.
New York Harbor aviation-quality 54-grade was offered at 3.75 cents over May futures, with Gulf prompt back-tenth-cycle material sold for 0.85 cent above the print.
"There's just a little upward bias" on Gulf diffs, one player said, adding Exxon was heard looking for barrels.
New API data released late Tuesday showed total U.S. jet fuel stocks dropping by 781,000 barrels for the week ending March 28, to 38.4 million barrels.
